Course Length and Format

Average course completion time: 3.5 hours

You can enhance your learning in this course by doing the following:

  • Gain new knowledge and skills through readings, narrated PowerPoints, videos, and reflections.

  • Use your own personal journal to jot down your ideas—for your eyes only. Follow this link for more information. The purpose of the journal is to help you reflect on your learning. Journal activities are not required for course completion. You may also choose to use your own notebook or another document to take notes. If you require assistance using the journal, contact support@lincs.ed.gov.

  • Reach out and connect with other educators by commenting in the course thread in the LINCS Communities of Practice. Go to the Invitation to Check in with Other Educators Page for more information.

  • Earn a certificate of completion by viewing all activities in the course (unless marked "optional"), completing all quizzes with a score of at least 75% (7.5 points out of 10 possible), and by spending a total of at least 2 hours in the course (you may do this in smaller chunks of time). Please note that the checkmark for some items may not appear as "viewed" until after this course page is refreshed.

Course Objectives

Upon successful completion of this online course, participants will be able to do the following:

  • Identify the principles of learning for instructional design and describe examples of their application;

  • Observe an adult education class and describe how these principles are being implemented; and

  • Plan next steps in gathering additional information on the implementation of the principles in their own practice.
